Recently (1382) M. Stack replied concerning my need to be able to 
pass attributes from a parent URI (i.e. a CrawlURI) to children
(i.e. CandidateURIs), preferably by the AList method:

St. Ack wrote:
> Try it now. The AList has been moved back into the CandidateURI and
> put behind accessors/getters. CrawlURIs made from CandidateURIs 
> inside in Frontier will have whatever was in the CandidateURI AList
> when CrawlURI was created.

Well today I downloaded the current snapshot and finally got it 
running (this was my first time trying to build from CVS source).
I successfully compiled my code against the new snapshot but at
run-time something very strange happened: a runtime error from my
Postselector subclass's innerProcess method.  The statement in
question is:

   protected void innerProcess ( CrawlURI curi ) {
                  :
     if (curi.containsKey(A_PREREQUISITE_URI)) {

The runtime error is that there is no containsKey(String) method
in CrawlURI (!):

   java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:   
   org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlURI.containsKey
   (Ljava/lang/String;)

A similar message happens for all the AList-related methods that 
were recently moved out of CrawlURI into CandidateURI.  This error
just makes no sense to me.  CrawlURI definitely subclasses 
CandidateURI, CandidateURI definitely has the containsKey method,
the javadocs (which I generated today from the downloaded source)
clearly say that CrawlURI inherits this method from CandidateURI,
and my Postselector subclass did, after all, compile.

I am runnning with Sun's JRE build 1.4.1_02-b06, but I doubt that
matters.

Any suggestions of where to look or what to test further?

> Refactorings to come will probably include adding a flag on 
> the AList setters so you can say whether your data is 
> transient or not -- i.e. whether it can be discarded at the 
> end of a pass through the processing chain (may also be 
> whether or not value should be serialized too TBD) -- and the
> Postselector will probably be broken in two with one piece
> focused on scope-checking and the other on scheduling.

Those sound like reasonable plans.  I also would like to have
back the protected CreateCandidateURI () method you designed
the other day.  I'd rather override just that method rather 
than the whole innerProcess of Postselector.

> Yours,
>St.Ack

bergmark_d wrote:
...

> What I would like: CandidateURI has an AList (null by default). The
> CreateCandidateURI method can be overridden (i.e. it has protected
> status) so that applications can stuff stuff (!!) into the
candidate's
> AList. When a CrawlURI is instantiated from a CandidateURI, it
should
> *merge* its Core Attribute thingies with whatever AList is in the
> CandidateURI.
>
We figured (smile).

> Given this implementation, it would be easy for apps to arrange for
> parent URIs to pass info to their children. And that would be good.
>
